transportAdvice: Seville's historic center is compact and highly walkable, with most major attractions reachable on foot; the city also has a metro system, an extensive bus network, and a tram line serving central areas. Taxis are widely available throughout the city, and cycling is popular thanks to a well-developed bike lane network.

weather.description: Mild and occasionally rainy winter days with cool evenings, but generally pleasant for sightseeing.
Slightly warmer than January with a mix of sunny spells and light rain showers.
Spring begins to emerge with warming temperatures and occasional showers between sunny periods.
Warm and pleasant with blooming orange trees, though brief spring showers are still possible.
Comfortably warm and mostly sunny, making it one of the best months to visit Seville.
Hot and dry with long sunny days; heat begins to intensify toward the end of the month.
Intensely hot and dry, with temperatures frequently exceeding 38Â°C; outdoor activity is best done early morning or evening.
Remains extremely hot and dry, similar to July; many locals leave the city during this peak heat period.
Heat begins to ease slightly and the city becomes more comfortable, though temperatures are still warm.
Pleasantly mild autumn weather with increasing chances of rain and comfortable daytime temperatures.
Cooler and wetter with a distinctly autumnal feel, though sunny days are still common.
Cool and occasionally rainy winter month with festive atmosphere in the lead-up to Christmas.
